item.title: Implementing slim CI for dbt with GitHub Actions
item.description: Recently I’ve started working with dbt, and have to say it’s quite amazing. With this post I’d like to share the approach for deploying only newly created/modified models, known as slim CI. Imagine we have an Airflow instance executing our dbt DAG daily. In case we introduce structural changes in our models, or simply by creating a new model, we don’t want to wait till Airflow starts on schedule. Also, we don’t want to fire the whole pipeline execution, because it might be costly to run it multiple times per day.
